input: Sentence 1: One day I was walking down the avenue in my city. Sentence 2: Dodging garbage and junkies on a Saturday, out dressed for fun. Sentence 3: With eyes on 5th street I lumbered out of an alley. Sentence 4: That's when I saw a black cat cross my path. Sentence 5: The day was done, I called my friend and told him I won't be coming. Choices: a. Crunch. b. AFO.

Sentence 1: Andrea was excited to go on vacation to Jamaica. Sentence 2: She was going on an anniversary trip with her husband. Sentence 3: Their first night, they sat on the beach and listened to steel drums. Sentence 4: They danced under the moonlight. Sentence 5: When they got home, Andrea started planning their next trip. Choices: a. The Steel Drums. b. The Trip.

Sentence 1: Bill was walking home when he saw a dog in trouble. Sentence 2: The dog was on a chain but had tried to jump the privacy fence. Sentence 3: Now the dog was hanging by its collar about two feet off the ground. Sentence 4: Bill ran over and lifted the dog up so it could breathe. Sentence 5: A neighbor came to help and together they rescued the dog. Choices: a. Near Miss. b. Last Minute.

Sentence 1: There was a recall on cans of tuna. Sentence 2: I searched high and low in my cupboards. Sentence 3: I finally found my cans of tuna. Sentence 4: I found out that the cans I owned had been recalled. Sentence 5: I had to throw all of my tuna away. Choices: a. The Big Let Down. b. Tuna Cans.

Sentence 1: The last time we drove through Arkansas, we saw the nuclear plant. Sentence 2: My son immediately asked if it really was a giant chicken cooker. Sentence 3: I smiled at him in the rearview mirror but didn't answer. Sentence 4: He laughed and said I tricked him. Sentence 5: He and I agreed to keep it a secret from his sister. Choices: a. Chicken Cooker 2. b. The Failed Athlete.

Sentence 1: Carlo wanted to go to the circus. Sentence 2: The circus announced a new attraction. Sentence 3: It was about a real live unicorn. Sentence 4: When Carlo got there he was very excited. Sentence 5: The unicorn was a goat with a single horn. Choices: a. Circus. b. Laughter.

Sentence 1: Brad pulled into his driveway and saw his garage door was open. Sentence 2: Someone had broken in and stolen his tools! Sentence 3: Brad called the police immediately. Sentence 4: He was starting to feel very unsafe. Sentence 5: The police suggested he get a security system. Choices: a. The Thief. b. The dumpster fan.

Sentence 1: Graham put his new product idea on a crowdfunding site. Sentence 2: Graham raised five thousand dollars for his product idea. Sentence 3: He delivered the first of his new product to his customers. Sentence 4: He got sued for product infringement. Sentence 5: He lost all of his money in the lawsuit. Choices: a. New Product. b. Chess.

Sentence 1: Sam was at his friend's wedding rehearsal. Sentence 2: He started drinking too early. Sentence 3: When his toast came up he was already too drunk. Sentence 4: Sam made a lot of rude comments. Sentence 5: His friend asked him not to attend the wedding anymore. Choices: a. Wedding Rehearsal. b. Jeff loses his shirt.

Sentence 1: I started cleaning out my closet. Sentence 2: I found my favorite boots in the bottom of the pile of shoes. Sentence 3: I put them on, and realized they didn't fit my calves anymore. Sentence 4: I resolved to lose weight and fit into them again. Sentence 5: Two months later, they fit perfectly. Choices: a. Old Shoes. b. Boots.

Sentence 1: Sally got a job at the local pharmacy. Sentence 2: Her new boss and coworkers were very hard on her. Sentence 3: The job stressed her out. Sentence 4: Sally was miserable. Sentence 5: Sally quit her job. Choices: a. Sally's New Job. b. Johnny Bakes A Pie.

Sentence 1: Valerie hired John to install her kitchen cabinets. Sentence 2: John was always late getting to work. Sentence 3: John did not finish installing the cabinets on time. Sentence 4: Valerie was not happy with John's work. Sentence 5: She called another carpenter when she needed bathroom cabinets. Choices: a. Valerie's Cabinets. b. The Deadline.

Sentence 1: I saw an ad on Facebook for a used table. Sentence 2: I did not really need one. Sentence 3: This was a great deal. Sentence 4: I bought it for ten dollars. Sentence 5: It was a steal. Choices: a. The new table. b. Ebay Store.

Sentence 1: My grandmother loved her hen house. Sentence 2: She fed the chickens every day. Sentence 3: One day my uncle accidentally burned it down. Sentence 4: She was very angry. Sentence 5: Almost 70 years later, she still hasn't forgiven him. Choices: a. Hen House. b. Herb Kent.

Sentence 1: Laurie was going camping. Sentence 2: She bought a new tent. Sentence 3: It was roomy. Sentence 4: She invited ten friends to camp with her. Sentence 5: They all had a great time. Choices: a. The Tent. b. The Doctors Appointment.

Sentence 1: Riley got a job as a coach in his home town. Sentence 2: He coached his team to five winning seasons in a row. Sentence 3: The athletic director fired Riley. Sentence 4: The local team started losing every game. Sentence 5: Riley refused to come back to his old coaching job. Choices: a. Good Coach. b. Veteran.

Sentence 1: My friend Sue's sister got married over the weekend. Sentence 2: It was her first wedding, at 46. Sentence 3: She is very attractive and we wondered why she took so long. Sentence 4: She ended marrying a very handsome man. Sentence 5: There were many nice FB photos of the wedding. Choices: a. NYC Wedding. b. The worst cup of coffee..

Sentence 1: Brad didn't like the way his wife drove a car. Sentence 2: Brad thought she was unsafe behind the wheel. Sentence 3: When Brad critiqued her driving she would get defensive. Sentence 4: Every car ride with his wife ended with an argument. Sentence 5: Brad decided that he would drive whenever they went somewhere. Choices: a. Nagging Husband. b. Windfall.

Sentence 1: Bill was riding his bike down the street. Sentence 2: He rolled to a stop sign, but didn't stop. Sentence 3: A car was passing through the intersection. Sentence 4: Bill's bike hit the tail end of the car. Sentence 5: Bill had to be hospitalized for a week. Choices: a. The Bike Ride. b. Dog House.
